text: {{Infobox settlement |name = Surunga |other_name = n/a |native_name = सुरुंगा |nickname = |settlement_type = Town |motto = |image_skyline = |image_caption = |image_flag = |image_seal = |image_map = |mapsize = 250px |map_caption = Map of the village development committees in Jhapa District |pushpin_map = Nepal |pushpin_label_position = bottom |pushpin_mapsize = 250 |pushpin_map_caption = Location in Nepal |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = Nepal |subdivision_type1 = Zone |subdivision_name1 = Mechi Zone |subdivision_type2 = District |subdivision_name2 = Jhapa District | |government_footnotes = |government_type = |leader_title = |leader_name = |leader_title1 = |leader_name1 = |established_title = |established_date = |unit_pref = |area_footnotes = |area_total_km2 = |population_as_of = 2011 |population_footnotes = |population_note = |population_total = 44,222 |population_density_km2 = auto |population_blank1_title = Ethnicities: Surunga has a mixed ethnicity including Bahun, Chhetri, Rai, Limbu, Satar, Damai, Kami, Rajbanshi as the major ethnic groups but has a large pool of Newar, Tamang, Magar, Marwadi and many other communities. |timezone = Nepal time |utc_offset = +5:45 |timezone_DST = |utc_offset_DST = |coordinates = |elevation_footnotes = |elevation_m = |postal_code_type = |postal_code = |area_code_type = |area_code = 23 |blank_name = |blank_info = |website = |footnotes = }} Surunga is a center for trade in Kankai Municipality of Jhapa District in Nepal. Kankai river flows from the western side of this place. The name Surunga came from word "surung" which means tunnel. It is believed that five brothers in mahabharat made a tunnel till there for escape.population detailsmaps ==References== Category:Cities in Nepal
title: Surunga
